Idiom (Aklanon): Nagabudlay ro tiyan, pero indi ro baba.
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: A person works hard but doesn't complain or talk about it.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Works silently without boasting or seeking praise.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Commonly heard in agricultural communities in Aklan, reflecting traditional values of humility.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Aklanon): [nagaˈbudlaj ɾo ˈtʃan, ˈpero ˈindi ɾo ˈbaba]
First Example Sentence: Si Tatay, nagabudlay ro tiyan, pero indi ro baba.
Second Example Sentence: Indi sida hambog, bisan nagatrabaho sanda adlaw-adlaw.
Third Example Sentence: Kon magsilbi ikaw, dapat pareho kang Tatay – nagabudlay ro tiyan, indi ro baba.

Idiom (Aklanon): Ginaubos ro tinapay, pero indi ginaubra ro trabaho.
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Someone who enjoys benefits but avoids responsibilities.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Derived from traditional mealtime expressions in farming households.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Aklanon): [ginaˈʔubos ɾo tinaˈpai, ˈpero ˈindi ginaʔuˈbɾa ɾo tɾaˈbaho]
First Example Sentence: Ginaubos ro tinapay, pero indi ginaubra ro trabaho nga ginsugo.
Second Example Sentence: Ginapangayo tanan, pero wala sing ginaubra.
Third Example Sentence: Kon gusto mo lang kaon, indi ikaw buligan.

Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Someone who meddles in messy or scandalous matters.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Gets involved in controversy or gossip.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Refers to traditional sayings about pigs wallowing in mud, applied to people indulging in drama.
First Example Sentence: Ayaw pag-apil, nagahilibiya ka lang it lapok.
Second Example Sentence: Ro mga nagahilibiya it lapok, permi ginaintriga.
Third Example Sentence: Gani nga indi ko gusto ro mga balita – puro nagahilibiya it lapok.

Idiom (Aklanon): Indi pagbutangan it asin ro sugat.
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Don't make a bad situation worse.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Avoid worsening someone’s pain or discomfort.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Originates from traditional Aklanon healing beliefs about open wounds and salt.
First Example Sentence: Kon nasayran mo nga masubo sida, indi pagbutangan it asin ro sugat.
Second Example Sentence: Ginpangakigan mo pa gid – nagdugang ka lang sakit.
Third Example Sentence: Gani nga indi ako maghambae anay – basi butangan ko pa it asin ro sugat.

Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Someone has good intentions but lacks power.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Wants to help but is unable to.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Heard often in village contexts when discussing elders or powerless figures.
First Example Sentence: Si Lola may buot pero walay gahum.
Second Example Sentence: Gusto ko tani buligan ka, pero may buot lang ako.
Third Example Sentence: Ro tawo nga may buot pero walay gahum, permi ginapasipalahan.

Idiom (Aklanon): Indi magpadag-on sa duta nga lain ro umagad.
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Do not trust or submit to outsiders easily.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Don’t let unfamiliar people take advantage.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Rooted in ancestral wisdom about land ownership and family hierarchy.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Aklanon): [ʔindi magpadaˈgon sa ˈduta ŋa laˈin ɾo ʔuˈmagad]
First Example Sentence: Indi magpadag-on sa duta nga lain ro umagad.
Second Example Sentence: Ginsugiran guid kami kang Lolo, ‘Ayaw itpati ro taga-lain.’
Third Example Sentence: Ro duta dapat ginabantayan, indi lang bisan sin-o ro tag-iya.

Idiom (Aklanon): Ginpatabok sa tulay nga indi pa natukod.
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Given a task or responsibility prematurely.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Tasked with something before being ready.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Alludes to risky crossings in rural areas with unfinished infrastructure.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Aklanon): [ginpataˈbok sa tuˈlaj ŋa ʔindi pa natuˈkod]
First Example Sentence: Ginpatabok ko sida sa tulay nga indi pa natukod.
Second Example Sentence: Wala pa training, ginassign na sa trabaho.
Third Example Sentence: Ginpapirma sa kontrata nga wala pa nabasa.

Idiom (Aklanon): Nagahalin ro itik kon mainit ro kawali.
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: People avoid danger or difficulty instinctively.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: People leave or react quickly when situations turn bad.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Refers to animal instincts, used in rural contexts.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Aklanon): [nagaˈhalin ɾo ʔitik kon maˈʔinit ɾo kawaˈli]
First Example Sentence: Nagahalin ro itik kon mainit ro kawali – pareho man sa tawo.
Second Example Sentence: Indi ka gid kahambae – nagpalagyo sanda.
Third Example Sentence: Nadungog lang nga may pulis, naghalin tanan.

Idiom (Aklanon): Ginahakot ro bitoon pero ginapabay-an ro lunang.
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Chasing dreams while ignoring basic needs.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Stargazing vs. muddy feet – metaphorical balance of dreams vs. grounding.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Aklanon): [ginahaˈkot ɾo bitoˈʔon ˈpero ginapabaˈʔan ɾo luˈnaŋ]
First Example Sentence: Ginahakot mo ro bitoon pero ginapabay-an ro lunang.
Second Example Sentence: Nagpangandoy siya pero wa't planong klaro.
Third Example Sentence: Indi pwedeng puro pangarap lang, kinahanglan matuod man sa duta.

Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Says things that offend or hurt others.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Refers to the pain of stepping on thorns, compared to speech that wounds.
First Example Sentence: Indi ako maghambae – may tinik sa dila ro tawo.
Second Example Sentence: Permi lang gid siya nagaaway, may tinik sa dila.
Third Example Sentence: Dapat kontrolado mo ro dila mo – indi puro tinik.
